intro: Alnus henedae, commonly known as the Guatemalan alder, is a deciduous tree native to Central America. It belongs to the Betulaceae family, which includes birches and hazelnuts. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, catkin-like flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riparian zones. Alnus henedae plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
